subject: Management
title: Knowing When to Escalate
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Knowing When to Escalate.

hook.text: A manager tried to mediate a harassment complaint between peers. It wasn't a mediation issue.

buildup.text: Not every conflict should be mediated at your level. Some require HR, legal, or senior leadership.

discovery.text: Escalate when: there's a power imbalance, policy violation, safety concern, or repeated failure to resolve.

twist.text: Escalating isn't failure. Trying to handle something beyond your scope is.

climax.text: Know your limits. Document what happened and hand off cleanly with full context.

punchline.text: Knowing when to escalate is a skill, not a weakness.

quiz.question: When should a manager escalate a conflict instead of mediating?
options: When there is a power imbalance, policy violation, or safety concern
Whenever the conflict is uncomfortable to address
Only after trying to mediate at least five times
